intro: Faberia silhetensis, commonly known as the Silhet faberica, is a flowering plant native to the hill regions of Bangladesh. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its trifoliate leaves and pod-like fruits. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its flowers are usually pale yellow or white, and it plays a role in soil enrichment due to its nitrogen-fixing ability.
